abstract.t: The Licklider Transmission Protocol (LTP) provides a reliable datagram convergence layer for the Delay/Disruption Tolerant Networking (DTN) Bundle Protocol. In common practice, LTP is often configured over UDP/IP sockets and inherits its maximum segment size from the maximum-sized UDP datagram. This document discusses LTP interactions with IP fragmentation and mitigations for managing the amount of IP fragmentation employed.
